content: tiers for the leg and 2 tiers for the foot although i probably could have just managed a third tier on the foot… there are only 2 different types of triangles the a triangle is worked from the base up in ever de- creasing short row the last will only have 2 sts and form the top of the triangle the b triangle is worked into the gap left between two a triangles and as such it is worked from the point upwards in ever increasing row the last row forming the top side of the triangle the design makes extensive use of short row i am employing the very traditional wrap-and-turn method and as such i would always expect each wrapped stitch to be worked together with its wrap when you come to working it even if this is not expressively stated in the instructions however feel free to substitute any other favourite short row method you could also simply work the wrapped sts plain in that case the wraps will be visible and highlight the diagonal lines within the pattern if you are unsure which principle to follow i would suggest to work the cuff and use a life line then work the first tier and see how you like it the pattern is designed so you can work the whole sock without cutting the yarn so you will not be left with short lengths of yarn if you decide to re-do any part of the sock cuff using your preferred cast-on method cast on 64/72 sts and close to a round taking care not to twist your cast on work k2 p2 rib for 24 rounds or to your preferred length leg after working the cuff you should have 2 circular needles each holding half of your sts work your first a triangle over the first half of your sts the 32/36 sts on needle 1 as follows *row 1 rs k31/35 wrap the next st turn row 2 ws p30/34 wrap the next st turn row 3 rs k to 2 sts before first wrapped st wrap next st turn row 4 ws p to 2 sts before first wrapped st wrap next st turn repeat row 3 and 4 until you have only 6 live sts turn k4 wrap next st turn * p2 wrap next st turn k1 this is the very top of your triangle you should now have 16/18 sts on each of your needles with the needles forming the two sides of the triangle with a new needle k the 16/18 sts down the left side of your triangle hiding wraps as you come to them see schematic broken jack page 3 now work your second a triangle as above from * to * p1 again you are at the top of the triangle with 16/18 sts forming each side but
